Package game.allies

Class Ally

java.lang.Object
edu.monash.fit2099.engine.actors.Actor
game.allies.Ally
All Implemented Interfaces:
Capable, Printable, Resettable
public class Ally
extends Actor
implements Resettable
An ally class that can have one of the roles that player can have Note: to call this class, use getInstance()

  • Method Details

    • getAllyInstance

      public static Ally getAllyInstance()
      The method to obtain an instance of this class, Note: the reason we need this method is because, the constructor has different parameters, so we need another level before calling the constructor which will decide the parameters Also, needs to be instantiated after player cause of the role manager instantiation inside
      Returns:
      an Ally instance

    • allowableActions

      public ActionList allowableActions​(Actor otherActor, java.lang.String direction, GameMap map)
      Not used
      Overrides:
      allowableActions in class Actor
      Parameters:
      otherActor - the Actor that might be performing attack
      direction - String representing the direction of the other Actor
      map - current GameMap
      Returns:
      ActionList the list of available actions that can be done by the player

    • playTurn

      public Action playTurn​(ActionList actions, Action lastAction, GameMap map, Display display)
      At each turn, select a valid action to perform. Approach description: 1) check if the actor has the AttackBehaviour 1.1) if yes, check if can attack anyone 2) check if actor has the WanderBehaviour 2.1) if yes, roam around the map
      Specified by:
      playTurn in class Actor
      Parameters:
      actions - collection of possible Actions for this Actor
      lastAction - The Action this Actor took last turn. Can do interesting things in conjunction with Action.getNextAction()
      map - the map containing the Actor
      display - the I/O object to which messages may be written
      Returns:
      the valid action that can be performed in that iteration or null if no valid action is found

    • reset

      public void reset​(GameMap map)
      Specified by:
      reset in interface Resettable
